results.abstract: New American Review Number 11: Ed by Theodore Solotaroff
results.snippet: Killing some between-appointments time in a Greenwich Village bookstore recently, I approached the cashier to pay for a purchase (it happens) and was both pleased and puzzled to see New American Review No. 11 prominently displayed among the...
results.lead_paragraph: Killing some between-appointments time in a Greenwich Village bookstore recently, I approached the cashier to pay for a purchase (it happens) and was both pleased and puzzled to see New American Review No. 11 prominently displayed among the volume-selling items by the counter -- the sensuous men and women, the exposes of business, political, and advertising hi-jinks, and the less prurient if hardly more artistic love stories that are paperback best sellers these days.

results.abstract: astronauts and wives begin 3-day visit to NYC; greeted at La Guardia Airport by Lindsay and wife; attend play and after-theater party; some of 125 celebrities in attendance at party listed; astronauts will attend Mar 8 heavyweight champ fight at Madison Square Garden; some of their planned activities during next 3 days detailed; illus of astronauts and Lindsay at theater

headline.main: Apollo 14 Astronauts in the City For Tour, Prizefight and Parties

results.snippet: The three astronauts of Apollo 14 arrived here yesterday afternoon for a three-day visit that will include a motorcade to City Hall, visits to the theater and to the Ali-Frazier championship prizefight and partygoing.
results.lead_paragraph: The three astronauts of Apollo 14 arrived here yesterday afternoon for a three-day visit that will include a motorcade to City Hall, visits to the theater and to the Ali-Frazier championship prizefight and partygoing.

headline.main: Astronauts Take a Day to Relax For Noon Parade Here Today

results.snippet: The three Apollo astronauts and their wives spent a quiet yesterday in rainy New York, the day before a noon parade down Fifth Avenue in their honor.
results.lead_paragraph: The three Apollo astronauts and their wives spent a quiet yesterday in rainy New York, the day before a noon parade down Fifth Avenue in their honor.

results.abstract: State Sup Ct blocks bd from implementing cuts pending hearing in response to suit filed by Dist Supt Wright who claims cuts were made without consulting local bds and will cause irreparable harm to pupils and system; Wright deplores cuts but says that if they are necessary, dists should be assigned lump-sum savings figure, leaving cuts to be determined by bd; some observers say suit is delaying tactic to give coalition more time to find funds; Bergtraum and Scribner say bd will comply with order; parents plan mother's march on City Hall during planned reception of Apollo 14 astronauts to dramatize need for funds; NYS chap of NAACP supports coalition; Jewish fraternal order Workmen's Circle calls on HEW Dept to provide funds; Shanker predicts 250,000 will attend coalition's rally

headline.main: COURT HOLDS UP ALL SCHOOL CUTS PENDING HEARING; Assemblyman Wright Wins Writ Answerable in State Court Tomorrow LEGALITY IS QUESTIONED Autonomy of Local Boards in Making Any Economies Is at Issue in Suit Court Holds Up All School Cuts Pending a Hearing Tomorrow

results.snippet: A State Supreme Court justice temporarily blocked the City Board of Education last night from implementing severe economy measures that were to take effect today.
results.lead_paragraph: A State Supreme Court justice temporarily blocked the City Board of Education last night from implementing severe economy measures that were to take effect today.

results.abstract: astronauts ride in ticker-tape parade, Lower Bway; illus; they are cheered by scattered crowds; demonstrators demanding more money for educ and welfare housing stop motorcade several times; illus; astronauts are accompanied by Lindsay and Comr Palmer; get NYC Gold Medal from Lindsay, City Hall ceremony; proceedings are interrupted by chanting demonstrators; incident described; astronauts give Lindsay US flag and astronaut patch that they carried to moon; eat lunch at UN with new US Amb Bush; appear on 2 more TV shows

headline.main: Protests Interrupt City Welcome for Astronauts; Protests Interrupt City's Welcome for 3 Astronauts

results.snippet: The Apollo 14 astronauts, interrupted occasionally by demonstrations for better schools and welfare housing, received the honors of the city yesterday.
results.lead_paragraph: The Apollo 14 astronauts, interrupted occasionally by demonstrations for better schools and welfare housing, received the honors of the city yesterday.

results.abstract: Ex-Gov of New Mex D F Cargo appears on Albuquerque TV station as newsman; is outspoken critic of Gov's office and Legis; F Chavez Jr, who ran against Cargo for Gov in '68 and made unsuccessful bid for election to Cong, is TV commentator on a rival Albuquerque station; some legislators and newsmen critical of both men

headline.main: Alarm Devised for Watering Systems; Wide Variety of Ideas Covered By Patents Issued During Week
